thread.title: Reebok Enters the Knitted Sneaker Game With the Zoku Runner
thread.title_full: Reebok Enters the Knitted Sneaker Game With the Zoku Runner

author: Graeme Campbell
title: Reebok Enters the Knitted Sneaker Game With the Zoku Runner
text:
Visit the original post to see all 12 images from this gallery. 
adidas has Primeknit, Nike has Flyknit and now Reebok has Ultraknit. For SS17, the sportswear giant has announced the Zoku Runner Ultraknit which utilizes the technology for the first time.
Similar to lifestyle runners such as the Ultra Boost and Racer, the sneaker offers a modern refresh of classic titles which have come previously (“Zoku” means to be continued, or part of a tribe). A molded TPU cage offers support on the sock-like upper, while a DMX Foam (woof woof) midsole is incorporated for additional cushioning. With no room afforded to trivial design affectations, the shoe arrives in super-clean “Flat Grey,” “Solid Grey,” and “Coral Black” colorways.
The Zoku Runner Ultraknit arrives on March 2 for €129.95 (approx $138). Cop it over at the Reebok website .
Staying with spring-ready kicks, check out the Nike Flyknit Racer “Goddess” here .
